result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeremy D Grove was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 164 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Muskego Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Attend the Victim Impact Panel meeting as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 03/10/16 plea/sentencing.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jeremy D Grove in court with Attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.   Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Padurean makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 164 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

DL REVOCATION:  30  months

IGNITION INTERLOCK:  30  months

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Attend Victim Impact Panel 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (to be paid to Muskego Police Department as a condition of extended supervision)

FINE:  $3,293.00  & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500.00) and remainder due as a condition of extended supervision)


Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
